revised_title: Indian Beards and Customs: Debunking Myths and Exploring the Culture of the Six-Nations
tldr: The author, Richard Mc Causland, challenges the common belief that Native Americans lack beards. He shares his observations and experiences living among the Six-Nations, providing evidence that they have beards, which they pluck out from a young age. The text also offers insights into the social structure, customs, and traditions of the Six-Nations, including their tribal divisions, hereditary leadership, and the role of women in their society.
scientific_discipline: Social Sciences, Art, and Humanities > Anthropology
